For reasons that are not well understood, zoonoses from wildlife has been increasing over the last half‐century, and represent the most significant, growing threat to global health of all emerging infectious diseases.
1 Geographic hotspots, or maps reflecting zoonotic infectious disease risk have been identified in South American, Africa and South Asia
2 (Figure 1). Both SARS‐CoV‐1 and 2 arose in one of these “hot‐spots.” Future outbreaks are believed to be all but inevitable. 1, 3
